title: Research and innovation network for europe and africa
abstract: In response to the present objectives of the EU-Africa partnership in science, technology and innovation, and addressing the STI priorities of the 2014 EU-Africa Summit, RINEA addresses three specific and complementary objectives by a range of targeted activities: 1. Strengthening the quality and quantity of partnerships between research and innovation actors in EU Member states, in Associated Countries and in countries in Africa through networking events between research and business communities, through proposing the elimination of cooperation obstacles and optimising framework conditions and through raising awareness and disseminate information of cooperation opportunities for research and innovation partnerships offered by H2020 and by other major programmes in Europe and Africa. 2. Encouraging transnational coordination of programmes and policies for international cooperation in STI for greater coherence, joint ownership and resource efficiency, through advancing the model established by ERAfrica for jointly owned EU-Africa funding instruments for STI cooperation and through facilitating the launch and the management of calls for proposals around topics of mutual concern and relevance to the EU-Africa bi-regional partnership. 3. Supporting and enriching formal and informal processes of bi-regional STI policy dialogue between the EU and Africa through building wider understanding of the objectives and outcomes of formal bi-regional policy dialogue, through contributing to the evidence base for policy and decision making, including strategic priority setting, by the recognised governance structures of the EU-Africa STI partnership, e.g. HLPD, through supporting the implementation of outcomes of formal policy dialogue and through fostering exchange between formal and informal dialogue processes, and with relevant regional and sub-regional structures such as SFIC, AU technical committees and RECs. RINEAÂ´s activities will build on recent and existing initiatives an

motivations: There is a need to strengthen partnerships between research and innovation actors in EU and Africa to address shared challenges and priorities.
Cooperation obstacles and lack of awareness hinder effective collaboration between EU and African research and innovation communities.
Transnational coordination of STI policies and programmes is necessary for greater coherence and resource efficiency in EU-Africa cooperation.
objectives: Strengthen partnerships between EU and African research and innovation actors through networking events and elimination of cooperation obstacles.
Encourage transnational coordination of STI policies and programmes for greater coherence and joint ownership.
Support and enrich bi-regional STI policy dialogue between EU and Africa through evidence-based decision making and exchange between formal and informal processes.
methods: Organize networking events between research and business communities to foster partnerships and collaboration.
Advance the model established by ERAfrica for jointly owned EU-Africa funding instruments for STI cooperation.
Build on recent and existing initiatives to support the implementation of outcomes of formal policy dialogue and foster exchange between formal and informal processes.
results: Enhanced partnerships and collaboration between EU and African research and innovation actors.
Improved coherence and resource efficiency in EU-Africa STI cooperation through transnational coordination of policies and programmes.
More effective bi-regional STI policy dialogue between EU and Africa through evidence-based decision making and exchange between formal and informal processes.
llama_json.research_subject: EU-Africa research and innovation network for strengthened partnerships and cooperation

motivations: There is a need to strengthen the quality and quantity of partnerships between research and innovation actors in EU Member states, Associated Countries, and countries in Africa.
There is a lack of transnational coordination of programmes and policies for international cooperation in science, technology, and innovation (STI) between EU and Africa.
There is a need to support and enrich formal and informal processes of bi-regional STI policy dialogue between the EU and Africa.
objectives: Strengthen partnerships between research and innovation actors in EU Member states, Associated Countries, and countries in Africa through networking events, proposing the elimination of cooperation obstacles, and raising awareness of cooperation opportunities.
Encourage transnational coordination of programmes and policies for international cooperation in STI for greater coherence, joint ownership, and resource efficiency.
Support and enrich formal and informal processes of bi-regional STI policy dialogue between the EU and Africa.
methods: Organize networking events between research and business communities and disseminate information of cooperation opportunities.
Advance the model established by ERAfrica for jointly owned EU-Africa funding instruments for STI cooperation.
Build wider understanding of the objectives and outcomes of formal bi-regional policy dialogue and foster exchange between formal and informal dialogue processes.
results: Improved quality and quantity of partnerships between research and innovation actors in EU Member states, Associated Countries, and countries in Africa.
Enhanced transnational coordination of programmes and policies for international cooperation in STI.
Enriched formal and informal processes of bi-regional STI policy dialogue between the EU and Africa.
openai_json.research_subject: Strengthening EU-Africa partnerships in science, technology, and innovation

motivations: The EU-Africa partnership in science, technology and innovation requires strengthened collaboration to address mutual STI priorities identified at the 2014 EU-Africa Summit.
There is a need to overcome cooperation obstacles and optimize framework conditions for research and innovation partnerships between Europe and Africa.
Formal and informal STI policy dialogue processes between the EU and Africa need better support and enrichment to achieve greater coherence and joint ownership.
objectives: Strengthen the quality and quantity of partnerships between research and innovation actors in EU Member states, Associated Countries and African countries through networking and awareness-raising activities.
Encourage transnational coordination of STI programmes and policies for greater coherence, joint ownership and resource efficiency between Europe and Africa.
Support and enrich formal and informal bi-regional STI policy dialogue processes between the EU and Africa.
methods: Organize networking events between research and business communities and propose elimination of cooperation obstacles while raising awareness of H2020 and other cooperation opportunities.
Advance the ERAfrica model for jointly owned EU-Africa funding instruments and facilitate the launch and management of calls for proposals on topics of mutual concern.
Build wider understanding of policy dialogue objectives, contribute to evidence base for decision making, and foster exchange between formal and informal dialogue processes.
results: Enhanced research and innovation partnerships between Europe and Africa with improved framework conditions and reduced cooperation barriers.
More coherent and efficient transnational STI programmes through joint ownership and coordinated funding instruments.
Strengthened bi-regional STI policy dialogue with better evidence base for strategic priority setting and implementation of partnership outcomes.
anthropic_json.research_subject: EU-Africa research and innovation partnership strengthening through networking, policy coordination and dialogue
